title: Qwinto
summary: On a turn, a player decides which dice to roll. They can choose to roll one, two or all three but must write the combined total to one of the matching tracks on their board. Other players may also choose to use the roll. Players try to best utilise the rolls for maximum score.

title: Tac Tix
summary: Lata and Raj try to outwit each other. On a turn they pick a row or column and remove any number of tokens that are next to each other. Whoever manages to take tokens last wins the game.

title: Jotto
summary: Lata thinks of a word and writes blanks for each letter. Raj makes a guess and Lata has to tell him the number of letters common to his word and hers as well as the number that are in the right place. Play continues till the word is revealed.

title: The Flower and the Wind
summary: The flower gets to place a mark each round. The wind selects a direction and adds seeds (in that direction) behind each flower. If every position is filled, the flower wins. If even one remains unfilled, the wind wins.

title: The Great Races
summary: Each player participates in 11 races. On a turn roll 4 dice and pair them up, adding their outcomes. Move on the races corresponding to these numbers. Once 8 races are completed, players score for being first or secnd in a race. The twist is that the player to reach a finish spot laater takes the award!

title: LAP
summary: Battleship's smarter older sibling! Lata and Raj each decide their tetromino maps. They now try to guess at each other's layout but probing locations on the map.

title: Don't Say 13
summary: Lata and Raj play a number game. Lata starts and can say either 1 or 2. Raj can add 1 or 2 to her number. They take turns until one of them is forced to say 13, losing the game.

title: Eat Poop You Cat
summary: Players sit in a circle, each with a pen and paper. Each one writes a sentence and then passes their sheet to the left. On the paper they received, they draw a figure for the sentence, fold so only their figure is seen and again pass the paper. Players now see only a figure for which they write a caption, fold to cover everything from before and pass again. Play continues until each receives their original sheet. At this point they can open it to see how their sentence has changed!

title: No Thanks
summary: Reveal a card. Either take it or place a token and pass it along. Cards give points and tokens reduce them. The player with the least points wins!

title: Battle Ship
summary: Players mark their battle ships on their hidden grid. Calling out grid locations they try to bomb and sink their opponents' ships.

title: Domineering
summary: 2 players, Lata and Raj, play a game of domino (placing or) shading. The two take turns shading 2 adjacent squares. Raj may only shade horizontally and Lata vertically. Whoever is able to make the last move wins the game.

title: Detectives
summary: The alphabet cards are shuffled, one removed and the rest distributed between the players. On a turn pass an opponent a query card to learn how many of those are in their hand. Players compete to deduce which card was removed.

title: Lines of Action
summary: Lata and Raj place their pieces on opposite edges of the board. A piece moves in a line a number of steps equal to the number of pieces in that line, into an empty space or removing an opponent. The first to get all their pieces in a single cluster wins the game.

title: Criss Cross
summary: 2 dice are rolled and each player enters both numbers to adjacent (like a domino) spaces of their board. Players aim to maximise their score by placing digits next to themselves.

title: Tablut
summary: An exciting ancient game of Viking chess, white attempts to get the king to the boundary and black attempts to surround and capture the king.

title: Char Par
summary: Lata and Raj each have 9 tokens in their colour that they take turns placing to the board, attempting to make a line of 3. Once a line is formed, an opponent piece is removed. Once all tokens are placed, tokens can be moved.

title: 13 Sheep
summary: A die is rolled each round. Players draw the fence corresponding to the outcome somewhere on their individual boards. Fences may not overlap, intersect or pass through bushes. The player who protects the most sheep at the end of the game wins.

title: Sequencium
summary: Lata and Raj take turns writing their next highest number to an empty adjacent square on the board. The player who places the highest number wins the game.

title: Two Rooms and a Boom
summary: Each player recieves a card that indicates their team and character. The blue team has the president and the red team a bomber. Players are split into 2 groups. Members of the red team aim to get president and bomber in the same room while members of the blue team aim to prevent this.

title: Konane
summary: An old Hawaiian checkers game. Konane starts with tokens on all spaces. Players remove 2 tokens to begin the game which proceeds with a player removing an opponent's piece from the board by jumping their piece over it. The player unable to move loses the game.

title: Hold that Line
summary: Lata draws a line connecting 2 dots on a 4 x 4 grid. Raj can now extend one end of the line, connecting to another dot. Play continues and the last one to extend the line loses!

title: Sprouts
summary: Play starts with 3 dots on an empty page. Lata and Raj take turns joinining any two dots and placing a new dot on this new line. Previous lines may not be crossed and once a dot has 3 lines coming out of it, it can no longer be used. Player who is able to make the last line wins.

title: Star Nim
summary: Lata and Raj take turns removing tokens from the board. On a turn they can always remove one token. They could remove two, if the tokens are connected by a line. The one who removes the last token wins the game.

title: Fake Artist
summary: Each player recieves a folded chit of paper with a word. All but one, the fake artist, receives the same word. They take turns drawing a curve on a shared sheet. After each has drawn 2 curves each (including the fake artist) points to another player, accusing them of being the fake. If most point to the fake, he has a chance to guess the word. If correct he wins. Otherwise the artists win. If they get it wrong, the fake wins.

title: Watch Your Step
summary: Players take turns rolling a dice trying to lead the pack but not fall off the cliff!

title: Goats and Tigers
summary: 3 tigers start on the board. Every round a goat is added, then a tiger moved. If able, a tiger can jump over a goat to capture it. Once all 15 goats are placed, they too move on their turn.The goats win if the tigers cannot move. Tigers win if they capture 5 goats.

title: Corners
summary: Lata and Raj take turns shading and making circles of their colour on the board. At the beginning of a turn, if they notice a square formed by circles of their colour they shade them. A shaded corner can be part of a new square later and unshaded corners are now shaded. Once the board is full, each player scores 3 points per shaded corner. The player with the most points wins the game.

title: Ultimate Tic Tac Toe
summary: Lata and Raj play nested tictactoe. Each move decides the board on which the other can play. By winning a board they make their mark on the main board. Players aim to make a line of 3 by winning 3 boards in a row.

title: Peg Solitaire
summary: This single-player game starts with pieces on all but one space on the board. Jumping a piece over another removes it from the board. The aim is to get to a single token.

title: Paper Boxing
summary: Leaving the top-left corner of the board empty, Lata and Raj secretly enter the numbers from 1 to 15 into their 4 x 4 grid boards. Each round, by connecting to the previous number, they select the number for the bout, comparing it to the other player's. The higher number wins the bout for a point. Play continues with players extending their lines to an empty neighbour selecting the new number to box. Play continues till all numbers are used or it is no longer possible to play and the player with hihgest score wins.

title: Hex
summary: Lata and Raj take turns colouring in a hex on the board. Lata tries to connect the sides in her colour. Raj tries to connect the sides in his colour.

title: Black Box
summary: One player decides the location of 5 atoms in a black box. The other shines light into the box and, using the rules of scattering, deduces the position of each atom.

title: Racetrack
summary: A game that models accelarations of a car around a racetrack, players aim to successfully navigate turns without crashing and be the first across the finish line.

title: 3 Red 1 Black
summary: Each player gets 4 cards — 3 red and 1 black. Play proceeds around the table with each player placing a card in front of themselves or opening a bid on the number of reds on the table. Any player may raise the bid whoever wins starts revealing cards. First all their cards on the table then, starting from the top, cards in front of any number of opponents. If the revealer finds a black card, they lose a card. If they open all the cards they bid for they receive a point. First to 2 points wins the game.

title: Mafia
summary: This is a multi-player social deduction game. Players are given the role of either townsfolk or mafia. The townsfolk want to remove the mafia from town and the mafia to kill atleast half the townsfolk.

title: Order and Chaos
summary: 2 players — Order and Chaos — play a game of TicTacToe. They take turns placing a mark on the board. Either can play either a O or an X on their turn. Order wants to create a line of 5. Chaos wants to prevent it. Who will succeed?

title: Saesara
summary: A game of inductive reasoning, in Saesara players aim to unravel the clue giver's secret rule.

title: Kachufal
summary: A different number of cards are dealt to players each round. Players decide how many tricks they believe they can win and the trump is set by drawing the top card. The hand size reduces from 10-1 over 10 rounds. Player who wins the most tricks also wins the game.

title: Regicide
summary: Regicide is a co-operative game played with a regukar deck of cards. The King, Queen and Jack cards represent the royalty and are placed on the board. Players are dealt cards from the rest of the deck. They play their hand attempting to bring the royals to their side and win the game.

title: Amazons
summary: Start by placing tokens of two colours in the indicated space. These are your warrior queens, Amazons, and each moves like a chess queen (as far as they like in any direction). On a turn a piece must move and then shoot a flaming arrow. The arrow can land as far as you like, in any direction from the piece. Cross off the square where the Arrow lands. No piece or arrow can cross a burnt position. The last player able to take a turn (move and shoot) wins the game.

title: Toads and Frogs
summary: Place 3 black (toad) tokens on the left most spaces and 3 white (frog) tokens on the rightmost spaces of the board. On a turn, a piece can move a single step (toward the centre of the board). They can also jump over an opponent piece into an empty space. The player who is able to make the last move wins the game.

title: Liar's Dice
summary: Players shake their dice in a cup and keep them covered on the table. After secretly looking at their own dice they bid on the rolls of the whole table. Succesful bids give points but unsuccesful ones result in the loss of dice!

title: Neighbours
summary: This is a game that an entire class can play. Each player gets a board (grid) and a pen. Both dice are rolled and the values added. Each player writes this number on their board. Once the grid is filled, both row and column scores are calculated. Score is based on the number of times a digit is placed adjacent to itself. Maximum score wins.

title: Digit Party
summary: Each player has a 5 x 5 grid onto which they place the digit called. A digit forms a link with neighbours that have the same value. Players aim to pack their digits in for the most points once the grid is full.

title: Dicey Dice
summary: Players decide to place bets on up to 3 spaces on the board. 2 dice are rolled and payoffs earned for successful bids. The player with the most money after 10 rounds wins the game.

title: Blockade
summary: Lata and Raj may either move their pawn forward a step or place a wall to block their opponent's progress. The first player to reach the other side wins the game.

title: Aces and Faces
summary: This game is played with only the Aces, Jacks, Queens and Kings from a deck of cards. Each cards has four characteristics (colour, gender, suit type and royalty). Lata and Raj give each other a card to place each round. The first to make a line of four with shared characteristic wins.

title: Monikers
summary: A more involved version of charades, this game is played over several rounds. In the first round, players give verbal clues to get their group to guess as many words as possible. In subsequent rounds, with the same word list, players may use only a single word, actions and finally just the movement of one hand. The group that guesses the most words wins the game.

title: Khatti Mithai
summary: All the squares on the board are filled with white tokens -- except the bottom left corner which has a black piece. On a turn pick a token and remove it as well as all tokens above and to the right of it. Player who takes the black token loses the game.

title: Bowling Solitaire
summary: Two suits of playing cards represent bowling pins and balls. A single player game, we use some number theory to hit as many of the pins as possible each round.

title: Dodgem
summary: Lata and Raj race across their finish lines. Cars may not reverse or jump over each other. The player with no moves remaining wins the game.

title: Eleusis Express
summary: In this game of inductive reasoning, the clue giver thinks of a rule. Players place cards from their hand trying to experimentally determine the clue-giver's rule.

title: Farkle Frenzy
summary: A turn starts with 6 dice to roll. Set aside any number of dice, incrementing your score. Roll the remaining dice and again set aside any dice you want to long as score increases. If no die increments score, the turn ends at once with 0 points scored. If all 6 dice score, write your score down and take another turn! First to 10k wins the game.
